column1: Note: Common type used for comparison, if any is indicated in the cell. If the cell is blank, then no merging may be performed. Invalid base types are omitted.

column1: (1) Comparison between pointers is always meaningful â€“ pointers are always unsigned integers. Data pointer to function pointer comparisons are not necessarily valid, but if valid, an explicit cast is still demanded; such comparisons are a bad code smell.
